name: joules
description: The joule is the SI standard measure of energy. It is used by scientists.

name: kilojoules
description: The kilojoule is a thousand joules. The joule is the SI standard measure of energy. It is used by scientists.

name: megajoules
description: The megajoule is a million joules. The joule is the SI standard measure of energy. It is used by scientists.

name: gigajoules
description: The gigajoule is a billion joules. The joule is the SI standard measure of energy. It is used by scientists.

name: terajoules
description: The terajoule is a thousand billion joules. The joule is the SI standard measure of energy. It is used by scientists.

name: petajoules
description: The petajoule is a million billion joules. The joule is the SI standard measure of energy. It is used by scientists.

name: etajoules
description: The etajoule is a billion billion joules. The joule is the SI standard measure of energy. It is used by scientists.

name: tonnes of oil equivalent
description: A tonne of oil equivalent is the energy content of a very specific tonne of oil. It is not the energy content of any particular tonne of oil. It is used by the IEA statistics and the UK Digest of Energy Statistics when counting overall demands and supplies for all types of energy.

name: thousands of tonnes of oil equivalent
description: A thousand tonnes of oil equivalent is the energy content of a very specific thousand tonnes of oil. It is not the energy content of any particular tonne of oil. It is used by the IEA statistics and the UK Digest of Energy Statistics when counting overall demands and supplies for all types of energy.

name: millions of tonnes of oil equivalent
description: A million tonnes of oil equivalent is the energy content of a very specific million tonnes of oil. It is not the energy content of any particular tonne of oil. It is used by the IEA statistics and the UK Digest of Energy Statistics when counting overall demands and supplies for all types of energy.

name: square metres
aliases: square meter, meter2, metre squared, meter squared
description: A <b>square metre<b> is the SI standard measure of area. It is used by scientists.

name: hectares
description: A hectare is a metric measure of area. It is used when referring to areas of land.

name: ares
description: The are is a metric unit of area, equal to 100 square meters, used for measuring land area. It was defined by older forms of the metric system, but is now outside of the modern International System (SI). It is commonly used to measure real estate, in particular in Indonesia and in French-, Portuguese-, Slovakian-, Czech-, Polish-, Dutch-, and German-speaking countries as also in India . sotka is the Russian name. Source: Wikipedia.

name: petagrams of carbon
description: The traditional measure of greenhouse gas quantity, when considered at a global scale

name: grams of carbon
description: The fundamental unit of measure of greenhouse gas quantity, but too small for practical use.

name: megatonnes of carbon dioxide equivalent
description: A common measure of greenhouse gas quantity, when considered at a national scale

name: gigatonnes of carbon dioxide eqiuvalent
description: A common measure of greenhouse gas quantity, when considered at a global scale

name: watt-hours
description: A watt-hour is the energy emitted by running something with 1 watt of power for 1 hour.

name: kilowatt-hours
description: Kilowatt-hours are the unit used by electricity companies when reporting how much electricity a house has used. It is a thousand watt-hours.

name: megawatt-hours
description: Megawatt-hours are thousands of kilowatt-hours, which are the unit you see on your electricity bill. This unit is typically used for total electricity consumed by a factory over a year.

name: gigawatt-hours
description: Gigawatt-hours are millions of kilowatt-hours, which are the unit you see on your electricity bill. This unit is typically used for total electricity consumed or produced by a power station.

name: terawatt-hours
description: Terawatt-hours are billions of kilowatt-hours, which are the unit you see on your electricity bill. This unit is typically used for total electricity consumed or produced at a National level.

name: therms
description: The Therm is an archaic British measure of energy. Equal to 100 000 BTUs.

name: British thermal units
description: The British Thermal Unit is an archaic British measure of energy.
